intro: Gompholobium karijini, commonly known as the Karijini gompholobium, is a shrub native to the Pilbara region of Western Australia. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, also known as the legume or pea family, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant produces yellow to orange flowers that bloom in spring, attracting a variety of pollinators. Its seeds are enclosed in pods and are adapted for dispersal by wind or animals. Gompholobium karijini is well adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils and open woodlands.
